column4: When compiling software, if you have an .sh file (for instance genfslist.sh) does not that file need to be executable?
if its not executable you need to do 'sh whatever.sh' then
I got the tarball for the program that allows you to "pretty up" the grub screen, and I am trying to compile it.  However, even the configure file isn't executable till I make it so.

It does not seem like the program would compile if files that need to be executable, aren't.  Or am I missing something?  BTW, some of the .sh files are executable and some are not.  Might they get changed to executable when configure runs?
